# offset

**Instance Property**

The time, in seconds, at which the animation begins within the duration.

## Declaration

```swift
var offset: TimeInterval { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default value is `0`, which indicates that the animation plays with no offset. Setting a value for this property moves the animation data along the timeline and doesn’t change timing. If you set a `AnimationAction/fillMode` other than [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationFillMode/none], the animation fills the vacant area created by the offset according to the characteristics of the specified fill mode.
